column7: Application of mathematical programming methods to discrete models in agricultural economics; Kuhn-Tucker theorem, Lagrange multipliers, duality, simplex method as applied to linear and quadratic programming, and input-output analysis models in agriculture. Prerequisite: MATH 124; one of MATH 220, MATH 221, MATH 234.
column9: Prerequisite: MATH 124; one of MATH 220, MATH 221, MATH 234.
column11: Recommended for graduate students. Juniors and seniors must obtain consent of instructor to register.
